text: Tribute to Uncle Ray is the second studio album by American singer-songwriter Stevie Wonder (then known as "Little Stevie Wonder") . It was released in October 1962, not long after Wonder's debut album The Jazz Soul of Little Stevie, which was also released in 1962. ==Background== The album was released to match the success of Ray Charles who was also a blind African American R&B; singer.Ribowsky, Mark. Signed, Sealed and Delivered: The Soulful Journey of Stevie Wonder ==Track listing== All songs composed by Ray Charles, except where indicated. #"Hallelujah I Love Her So" #"Ain't That Love" #"Don't You Know" #"The Masquerade" (Herbert Magidson, Allie Wrubel) #"Frankie & Johnny" (Traditional) #"Drown in My Own Tears" (Henry Glover) #"Come Back Baby" #"Mary Ann" #"Sunset" (Stevie Wonder, Clarence Paul) #"My Baby's Gone" (Berry Gordy, Jr.) ==References== Category:1960s albums Category:R&B; albums Category:Soul albums Category:Jazz albums Category:Stevie Wonder albums
title: Tribute to Uncle Ray
